A reference to the current interceptor(self)

description.full:
Attach an interceptor to the type or instance. Can be chained with multiple using clauses

Example:

function AnyObject() {};
function interceptor1(proceed) { proceed();}
function interceptor2(proceed) { proceed();}

scarlet.intercept(AnyObject) 
            //indicates the first interceptor to be called
            .using(interceptor1)
            //indicates the second interceptor to be called
            .using(interceptor2);
            //-> AnyObject will now have the two interceptors attached
description.summary: Attach an interceptor to the type or instance. Can be chained with multiple using clauses
description.body:
Example:

function AnyObject() {};
function interceptor1(proceed) { proceed();}
function interceptor2(proceed) { proceed();}

scarlet.intercept(AnyObject) 
            //indicates the first interceptor to be called
            .using(interceptor1)
            //indicates the second interceptor to be called
            .using(interceptor2);
            //-> AnyObject will now have the two interceptors attached

tags.description: A reference to the function being intercepted

description.full:
Provides the type or instance with the added intercepters. This is needed when intercepting a function.

Example:

function AnyObject() {};
AnyObject = scarlet.intercept(AnyObject)
                    .using(interceptor)
                    .resolve();
//-> AnyObject will contain the **interceptor**
description.summary: Provides the type or instance with the added intercepters. This is needed when intercepting a function.
description.body:
Example:

function AnyObject() {};
AnyObject = scarlet.intercept(AnyObject)
                    .using(interceptor)
                    .resolve();
//-> AnyObject will contain the **interceptor**

tags.name: object
tags.description: the original object or function

tags.name: method
tags.description: the method being intercepted

tags.name: args
tags.description: the original args passed into the function being intercepted

description.full:
The object or function that has been intercepted

Maintains the following properties for the object or function being intercepted:

  • args (Object) - The original args passed into the function being intercepted
  • object (Function|Object) - The original object or function
  • method (Function|Object) - The method being intercepted
  • result (Function|Object) - The result of the method being intercepted
description.summary: The object or function that has been intercepted
description.body:
Maintains the following properties for the object or function being intercepted:

  • args (Object) - The original args passed into the function being intercepted
  • object (Function|Object) - The original object or function
  • method (Function|Object) - The method being intercepted
  • result (Function|Object) - The result of the method being intercepted

tags.description: of the result of the original method call

description.full: Allows the intercepted method to be called
description.summary: Allows the intercepted method to be called

tags.name: interceptor
tags.description: the scarlet interceptor to apply

description.full:
Creates an Proxy for an instance or object

Example:

//init a scarlet interceptor
var interceptor = new Interceptor(someInstance);

//create the ProxyInstance with the scarlet interceptor
var proxy = new ProxyInstance(interceptor);

//Set the proxied method to call when the instance gets called
proxy.whenCalled(function(method,args){
        //-->Do stuff with the method and args of the proxied object
});        
//--> someInance will now call the proxy when it's called
description.summary: Creates an Proxy for an instance or object
description.body:
Example:

//init a scarlet interceptor
var interceptor = new Interceptor(someInstance);

//create the ProxyInstance with the scarlet interceptor
var proxy = new ProxyInstance(interceptor);

//Set the proxied method to call when the instance gets called
proxy.whenCalled(function(method,args){
        //-->Do stuff with the method and args of the proxied object
});        
//--> someInance will now call the proxy when it's called

comments.code:
function ProxyInstance(interceptor) {

	var self = this;

description.full: The scarlet interceptor
description.summary: The scarlet interceptor

comments.code: self.interceptor = interceptor;

tags.description: the target method to call when the proxied object is called
the type being intercepted with the proxy attached to the instance

description.full:
Creates an Proxy for a prototype Function Object

Example:

//init a scarlet interceptor
var interceptor = new Interceptor(someInstance);

//create the proxyPrototype with the scarlet interceptor
var proxy = new ProxyPrototype(interceptor);

//Set the proxied method to call when the instance gets called
someInstance = proxy.whenCalled(function(method,args){
        //-->Do stuff with the method and args of the proxied object
});
//--> someInance will have the  proxy attached to its prototype
description.summary: Creates an Proxy for a prototype Function Object
description.body:
Example:

//init a scarlet interceptor
var interceptor = new Interceptor(someInstance);

//create the proxyPrototype with the scarlet interceptor
var proxy = new ProxyPrototype(interceptor);

//Set the proxied method to call when the instance gets called
someInstance = proxy.whenCalled(function(method,args){
        //-->Do stuff with the method and args of the proxied object
});
//--> someInance will have the  proxy attached to its prototype

comments.code:

	var self = this;

    .using(someInterceptorFunction);
